result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando N Barry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Physically Disabled [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections. Comply with mental health program at the VA. Report to the Turning Point Program. Be involved in Domestic Violence counseling. No contact with the victim S.P.G (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by the agent. Engage in Hopes Center Program for Veterans. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 6/11/2019: To reflect 457 days of credit for time served.**
Concurrent with: 16CF183.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with Ms. Gregory or Ms. St. Martin.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including mental health programming.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
